comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: New York Giants manager John McGraw signed Marshall in the runup to the 1915 season. Marshall had torn up the Three I (or Three-Eye) League in the minors the year before. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F10A13FB3C5C13... Can't find any record that he made the Giants roster, or played anywhere in the Majors, however.

comment.author: 21050171@N07
comment._content: Batted .403 in 1914 for the Blue Sox with 2 home runs only played in 19 games www.baseball-reference.com/minors/team.cgi?id=51496952

comment.author: 21050171@N07
comment._content: Played in the Minor Leagues for five years and only had the one year when he played in only 19 games where he hit with a good average www.baseball-reference.com/minors/player.cgi?id=marsha002rob Did not play in the minors in 1916 and played for St Paul in 1915 in 1920 he played for the Moose Jaw Robin Hoods in the Western Canadian League and batted .326 in 111 games

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: He didn't have much of a career, really.  Mostly in B leagues in the minors and only a little over a years worth of games total in his whole 5 season career.
